intro: Icacorea clavelligera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and they bloom during the warmer months. Icacorea clavelligera is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance.
